result.execSummary:
The defendant Stanley D McBride was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Reckless Injury [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With credit for 201 DAYS time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
- Anger Management Program.
- Mental Health Evaluation, comply with recommended treatment and take all prescribed medications.
- Parenting Classes.
- AODA Assessment, comply with recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes:
- Court set Restitution at ZERO.
- Court ordered EXTRADITION COSTS in the amount of $689.22 payable to Milwaukee County District Attorney's Office. 
District Attorney's Office to file documentation.
- Court ordered Defendant to provide a DNA SAMPLE and pay DNA SURCHARGE, payable from Defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the Department of Corrections (DOC). Remainder to be paid during the period of Extended Supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
- Court WAIVED COSTS/FEES due to Indigency.

- Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition or body armor. 
- Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stanley D McBride

records.addlTxt: Extradition Costs - Supporting Documentation; received and filed.

Defendant Stanley D McBride in Court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in Court for Stanley D McBride.  Attorney Eric Bashirian in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Sentencing proceeded. Court reviewed Character Reference Letters. State complied with Victim Notification. Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant. Additional Statements by: Vernell M. and Christopher S. 

AS TO COUNT 1:  
Court sentenced the Defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of TEN (10) YEARS, with credit for 201 DAYS time served. 
The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is SEVEN (7) YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is THREE (3) YEARS.  

Court found Defendant is NOT ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 
Court found Defendant is NOT ELIGIBLE for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program. 
 
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-  Anger Management Program.
- Mental Health Evaluation, comply with recommended treatment and take all prescribed medications. 
- AODA Assessment, comply with recommended treatment. 
- Parenting Classes. 

Court set Restitution at ZERO. 

Court ordered EXTRADITION COSTS in the amount of $689.22 payable to Milwaukee County District Attorney's Office. 
District Attorney's Office to file documentation. 

Court ordered Defendant to provide a DNA SAMPLE and pay DNA SURCHARGE, payable from Defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the Department of Corrections (DOC). Remainder to be paid during the period of Extended Supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 

Court WAIVED COSTS/FEES due to Indigency. 

Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition or body armor. 
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored. 
Court advised Defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; PreTrial Incarceration Credit; and Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Stanley D McBride in Court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent not in Court.  Attorney Eric Bashirian in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Sentencing hearing. Defense is in Jury Trial in Branch 36 and not available for today's hearing. Defense previously contacted the Court and confirmed his availability for the next Court date. Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 11:00 am. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
Character Reference Letter submitted on behalf of Defendant; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Stanley D McBride in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Stanley D McBride in custody.  Eric Bashirian appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

 Case in Court for SPEEDY Jury Trial. Discussion placed on the record. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State complied with Victim Notification. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record, and confirmed by Defense and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT  1: 
Defendant changed his plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to the plea, and advised of Constitutional Rights and maximum penalties. Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found Defendant knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waived all his rights. Parties stipulated to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis for the plea. Court found Defendant GUILTY as charged in the Information , and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 
 
Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, or body armor. 
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored. 

Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing hearing, Branch 46. Sentencing scheduled September 13, 2022 at 4:00 pm. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

FILED: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum, and Elements of the Offense/Jury Instructions.

Defendant Stanley D McBride in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Stanley D McBride in custody.  Eric Bashirian appeared for the State of Wisconsin

Case in Court for SPEEDY Jury Trial. Parties appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building for Second Call. Discussion placed on the record. Defense advised the Court of Defendant's request to Withdraw Attorney. Statements made by Defendant. State objected. Court Declined Defendant's request. Case remains in trial posture. Defense counsel is ready to proceed. State is ready to proceed. Case passed to address remainder of the Court's calendar.

Defendant Stanley D McBride in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Stanley D McBride in custody.  Eric Bashirian appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for SPEEDY Jury Trial. Parties appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building for First Call. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. Defense counsel is ready to proceed. State is ready to proceed. Case passed to address remainder of the Court's calendar.

Defendant Stanley D McBride in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Stanley D McBride in custody.  Eric Bashirian appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for a Jury Status hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense provided an update to the court. Case remains in trial posture. Case adjourned for SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Speedy Jury Trial scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Stanley D McBride in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Stanley D McBride in custody.  Eric Bashirian appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. State placed offer on the record. Defense advised the court of possible resolution and requested a Jury Status hearing. Court ordered case adjourned for Jury Status hearing and SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Jury Status hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 1:30pm. Hearing will be held Room 113 of the Safety Building. SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
Defense Motion in Limine; received and filed.
State's Witness List; received and filed.

Defendant entered a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.
EXPIRES SEPTEMBER 29, 2022

Defendant Stanley D McBride in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Stanley D McBride in custody.  Eric Bashirian appeared for the State of Wisconsin. **JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.** Defense requests a jury trial.  Motions in limine, jury instructions and witness lists to be filed by the pretrial date. Case is adjourned in Branch 46.

  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (11 pages) commencing 04-14-2022 by Kathleen S. Worden.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Stanley D McBride not in court, in custody.  Eric Bashirian appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant not produced. Discussion with parties. Defense counsel advises that they have received discovery materials, but are still awaiting an offer from the state. Case adjourned for an additional Scheduling Conference to Br 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 10:45 am.

Defendant Stanley D McBride in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent; BOTH APPEAR BY VIDEO.  Defendant Stanley D McBride in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Dukic.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

-received and filed. 
Attorney Stephen Sargent

Court ordered no contact with C.S and M.L
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring. Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Stanley D McBride in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Stanley D McBride in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stanley D McBride appeared by video means with Attorney.    Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.   Court advised defendant that due to nature of offense in Count 1 a sample of your DNA is required.  If the sheriff's department hasn't already obtained a sample I order them to do so.  There are circumstances that you can request the sample to be expunged from the data base pursuant to statute 165.77(4). DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
